programme.desc: Germán descubre que en el edificio hay una plaga de cucarachas, por lo que Magdalena le ordena que haga una inspección en su departamento.

programme.desc: Alguien grafiteó la fachada del edificio. Para retirarlo, Germán cambia el número de la entrada. ¿Recibirá Luis el paquete que espera? ¿Acudirán a pintar el departamento de Lorena?

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Magdalena descubre que las personas de tercera edad recibirán tarjetas de ayuda. La familia López Pérez intenta obtener el beneficio. A Luis le molesta que Benito tenga un auto nuevo.

programme.title: Vecinos

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Luis y Silvia anuncian su boda y los vecinos los convencerán para que se casen en el edificio y ayudarán a los preparativos.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Los vecinos se quejan de los ruidos que vienen del departamento de Luis y Silvita, Germán intenta reparar la tubería de Lorena y los López Pérez sufren de comezón.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Frankie regresa a vivir al edificio, con Lorena y con Benito, pero con la condición de que encuentre trabajo. Pero, en vez de eso, escribirá una nueva película.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Vanesa vuelve al edificio para visitar a los Vecinos y ponerse al corriente. Benito invita a su novia a "ver pelis" en el departamento, al enterarse de que sus papás saldrán.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Como Luis le ha preparado el desayuno, Silvita se encargará de prepararle a su esposo un platillo espectacular.

programme.desc: Germán le entrega a Vanessa cosas que le dejó don Roque, por lo que ambos lo recuerdan y homenajean. Lorena aprecia a Soledad, la nueva amiga de Benito.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Como el tamalero no deja dormir a Luis, este le pedirá que le baje a su bocina. Ve cuántos enemigos se echará encima, por dejar sin trabajo al tamalero.

programme.desc: Luis le pide a Silvita que deje de hablar con su ex, pues se siente incómodo, sin sospechar que Maru, ex de Luis, llegará a la puerta de su casa. Además, la obra de arte de Jorjais.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Todos se olvidan del cumpleaños de Germán, a pesar de estar invitados a la fiesta. Lorena y Frankie le dicen a Benito que volverá a los castings.

programme.title: Sortilegio
programme.desc: Alejandro returns home after a terrible accident to discover that he is married to Maria Jose, a poor, innocent girl who was deceived by Alejandro's brother Bruno. Bruno used Alejandro's name to marry Maria Jose, soon after he sent to kill his brother in hopes that Maria Jose would inherit Alejandro's fortune. But when Maria Jose arrives at the mansion she realizes that Bruno lied to her and used her. She is also scared when Alejandro is found alive and returns home. Doctors tell Alejandro that he suffers from memory loss but he is convinced he never met Maria Jose before and goes in search of the truth, but during this time and Maria Jose actually fall in love, while Bruno and Maura (Alejandro's ex-girlfriend) plot to break them up. Meanwhile, the brothers' mother Victoria has fallen in love with Fernando--Alejandro's best friend, so closer to his age than hers.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police organize a search of a neighborhood and find the suspect in a tight spot. A pastor calls the cops when a suspicious car parks behind his church. An officer gives valuable advice to a young mother with a troubled past.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A precarious foot pursuit ends with the suspect in an embarrassing position. A motorist calls the cops when a pedestrian loses his cool. A relationship is jeopardized when a man resorts to old habits.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A chatty motorist becomes agitated when officers start asking questions; police are shocked when a fleeing driver calls his wife in the middle of a pursuit; deputies catch a man lying and give him a test to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: With officers hot on his trail, a wanted suspect's world comes crashing down. A tearful woman calls deputies to help apprehend her hostile husband. During a traffic stop, one passenger tries to outrun the police and his past.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect turns a small problem into a huge one when he decides to run. A defiant woman reveals her misdeeds and puts her marriage at risk. Deputies investigate a suspicious female, but it's her friend that ends up in cuffs.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Surrounded by officers, a driver's sneaky passenger makes a bold move. Tempers flare between roommates after a woman feeds eggs to her dog. A deputy acts swiftly when he spots a dangerous object in the backseat of a vehicle.

programme.title: Cops

programme.desc: Tasers are deployed after an erratic suspect attempts to outsmart officers. A lawbreaker tries to convince detectives they didn't just see him commit a crime. An officer is called to supervise a ridiculous business transaction.

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: Having mastered their basic building blocks in Spain, Morocco and Iran, Monty Don sets out to explore the wide variety of gardens offering a slightly different vision of paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Beginning in Trieste, Monty heads down the Croatian coast in the footsteps of the Venetians. He visits a public garden created by an obsessive plantsman and is given a tour of ancient olive groves.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Dorset, a couple want to create an unusual Norwegian garden while in Bromley, another couple set out to create a peaceful Japanese tea garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In this series Monty Don travels around the country helping amateurs to create the garden of their dreams. This week he is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly-engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable. Armed with advice from Monty and plenty of enthusiasm, they set about creating the garden of their dreams. But with their wedding looming, can they get the planting done in time? Luckily, a trip to Sarah Raven's garden in Sussex might provide them with the inspiration they need. Meanwhile in Barnet, Monty gets stuck in on an overgrown allotment which is being turned into a site for keeping bees. The owner , Nighat wants to grow her own fruit and veg as well as bee friendly plants, but currently all that's there are weeds and overgrown trees. After a trip to a stunning forest garden, Nighat is determined to turn this site around. But can Monty persuade her to leave her worries at the garden gate and just go for it?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Horticulturalist Monty Don works with amateur gardeners to help them create the garden of their dreams.

programme.title: Walking With Cavemen
programme.desc: At this stage several kinds of ape men populated Africa, each with its own unique adaptations. These species were doomed as the African continent grew increasingly arid, but a new human species well adapted to a hot dry climate emerged.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: Archaeologist and historian Richard Miles explores the origins of one of the most profound innovations in our human story - civilisation. Starting in Uruk, the 'mother of all cities', in southern Iraq, he travels to Syria, Egypt, Anatolia and Greece, exploring the challenges posed by this experiment in a new way of being human.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: The program looks at the survivors and losers of the Bronze Age collapse and the civilizations which emerged in the Age of Iron.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: The program explores the blossoming of Greek art, philosophy and culture in the 5th century B.C. and contrasts it with its political discord, social injustice and endless war.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: Richard Miles traces Alexander the Great's battle-scarred route through Turkey, Syria and Lebanon to Egypt and ultimately to the western Punjab, Pakistan, where he discovers fascinating traces of a city where Greek west and Buddhist east were united in an intriguing new way. It was Alexander's successors, the Hellenistic Kings, who had to make sense of the legacy of this legendary adventurer. By knuckling down to the hard graft of politics, taxation and public works, they created something far more enduring than a mere legend - they built a civilization.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella, Ryan Callahan, and Danny Bolton travel to Hawaii's Big Island for a unique hunt. They stalk feral sheep in the lush mountainsides and target wild hogs on a coffee plantation, using the animals' movements through macadamia groves to their advantage. The episode highlights Hawaii's blend of hunting and conservation, ending with a Hawaiian-style feast featuring the fresh game they harvested.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella teams up with spearfishing champions Danny Bolton and Kimi Werner off Hawaii‚ coast for a thrilling underwater adventure. Targeting pelagic species like Mahi Mahi and yellowfin tuna, the crew navigates the deep blue waters, dodging sharks and learning to use fish aggregating devices (FADs) to attract game fish. After they spear a variety of species, including a massive Ono, the team ends with a fresh, ocean-to-table feast, celebrating the rich marine life of Hawaii.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this episode of MeatEater, Steven Rinella and Clay Newcomb head into Alaska's remote interior for a challenging moose hunt. Over a 10-day season, they navigate the rugged wilderness, using patient calling to attract moose. Finding a legal bull and navigating through thick vegetation are just two of the challenges faced on this trip. The hunt captures the essence of moose hunting: patience, adaptation, and persistence in one of the world‚Äôs wildest places.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this hunt, Steve introduces Randall Williams and Clay Newcomb to his fish shack in Prince of Wales, Alaska where they fish for cod, set shrimp pots and hunt for black bears.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. Steve jets off to his home state of Michigan to hunt for small game with friends Guy Zuck and Kevin Murphy.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this trip, Steve and Jason Phelps hunt for big mule deer in one of Idaho's most prized units, giving Steve an opportunity at his dream muley.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this hunt, Steve and Janis Putelis are in Florida with local, Richard Martinez, in search for the illusive Osceola Turkey.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. Steve heads down to the Bahamas to spearfish with friends Kimi Werner and Cameron Kirkconnell. They explore the clear waters of the North Atlantic to bring home a wide array of fish species, including Mahi Mahi and grouper.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella charters a float plane to drop off on a remote lake in Alaska‚Äôs coastal rainforest for a solo Sitka blacktail deer hunt. With challenging terrain, thick fog, and incessant rain, finding a buck won't be easy. But if Steve connects on a Sitka blacktail, he'll celebrate with a camp meal of rock-pounded tenderloin.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: As summer turns to fall, Steve heads into the backcountry of Alaska's Chugach Range. The bears here are on a quest to fatten up on high elevation blueberries before they hibernate for the winter. Steve will need to hike into steep, rugged terrain to find a fat black bear and some of the finest tasting meat available to the American hunter.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: For a waterfowler's dream hunt, Steven Rinella joins his friend, wildlife biologist Brandt Meixell, on a remote trip to some untouched Alaska wetlands in search of ducks and geese. With a spread of decoys and a loyal retriever, they try to get their limit and fill their bellies with willow-spit roasted whole duck.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Every year, a handful of hunters draw a mountain goat permit to hunt the Mills Creek region of Alaska‚ Kenai Peninsula. Steven Rinella holds one of the permits this year, and he and his brother Danny backpack into the mountains, into rugged country they‚ never seen, in hopes of finding a billy goat.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: On this trip, Steve travels to the Sacramento Valley in central California in search of a new challenge and seriously good food. 300 years ago Spanish settlers let a handful of pigs loose in order to turn acorns into bacon, and today Steve is hunting the feral descendants of those pigs. If he's successful in finding a wild boar, Steve will prepare a backcountry gourmet feast of pork loin roasted with apples and rosemary cooked in tin foil over a fire.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: With a trio of cantankerous, spit-hurling pack llamas, Steven Rinella, his brother Matt, and good friend Matt Moison camp and hunt the badlands of Eastern Montana for mule deer. Freezing cold temperatures and unforgiving topography add to the already-challenging job of finding a giant mule

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella heads into the mountainous desert backcountry of west Texas after Barbary sheep, or Aoudad. These introduced sheep from North Africa are hard to find and harder to hunt. Challenged by the harsh environment, rugged terrain, and elusive sheep, Steve finds this hunt to be one of the most difficult he has ever undertaken.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella takes to the canyons of the West Texas desert in search of javelina. In this broken, rocky terrain finding these unique critters isn't easy and getting a clear shot on a skunk pig with a bow is a whole other story. But Steve is inspired by the evidence of he finds of ancient hunters that used the area to prepare a meal that honors both the animal and our hunting ancestors.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella heads to Wisconsin to spend a few days on his buddy‚Äôs historical family farm to hunt small game and whitetails in the famed Driftless area. There's plenty of action and tasty wild game meals like Grilled Butterfly Venison Steaks and Hassenpfeffer rabbit stew.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico

programme.title: Salón México
programme.desc: Mercedes (Marga Lopez) dances for money with the clients of Salon Mexico, a famous cabaret in Mexico City. Her younger sister Beatriz (Derbez) studies in an expensive private school, paid by Mercedes. Obviously, young Beatriz doesn't know about her sister's job. Troubles begin when Mercedes wins a danzon contest with Paco (Acosta), her pimp. Paco refuses to share the prize with Mercedes, so she steals the money when he's sleeping.

programme.title: Sasquatch Unearthed: Mountain State Monsters
programme.desc: Beth Duncan is experiencing something truly bizarre on her property outside Wineberry, West Virginia. Here, amongst the hills and hollers of the mountain state, a mystery is unfolding that stretches the limits of what we know about Bigfoot. Accompanying her various encounters with a family group of Sasquatch, are mysterious lights, ghostly apparitions, and tales of growling, formless phantoms. Ron Lanham and Joe Perdue bring their years of paranormal research to the table in an effort to help Beth sort out just what is taking place. Meanwhile, various researchers from around West Virginia weigh in on the possibility that there is much more to the Bigfoot phenomenon than just an unknown ape in the woods.
